steps.thought: I found several relevant documents. Let me retrieve information about the Russian Civil War first, as that should contain details about when it ended.
steps.observation: The Russian Civil War (Russian: Гражда́нская война́ в Росси́и , "Grazhdanskaya voyna v Rossiyi" ; November 1917 – October 1922) was a multi-party war in the former Russian Empire immediately after the Russian Revolutions of 1917, as many factions vied to determine Russia's political future.  The two largest combatant groups were the Red Army, fighting for the Bolshevik form of socialism led by Vladimir Lenin, and the loosely allied forces known as the White Army, which included diverse interests favoring monarchism, capitalism and alternative forms of socialism, each with democratic and antidemocratic variants.  In addition, rival militant socialists and nonideological Green armies fought against both the Bolsheviks and the Whites.  Eight foreign nations intervened against the Red Army, notably the Allied Forces and the pro-German armies.  The Red Army defeated the White Armed Forces of South Russia in Ukraine and the army led by Admiral Aleksandr Kolchak in Siberia in 1919.  The remains of the White forces commanded by Pyotr Nikolayevich Wrangel were beaten in Crimea and evacuated in late 1920.  Lesser battles of the war continued on the periphery for two more years, and minor skirmishes with the remnants of the White forces in the Far East continued well into 1923.  The war ended in 1923 in the sense that Red control of the newly formed Soviet Union was now assured, although armed national resistance in Central Asia was not completely crushed until 1934.  There were an estimated 7,000,000–12,000,000 casualties during the war, mostly civilians.  The Russian Civil War has been described by some as the greatest national catastrophe that Europe had yet seen.

steps.thought: I have found detailed information about the Russian Civil War. The document states that the war lasted from November 1917 to October 1922, and it ended in 1923 when Red control of the Soviet Union was assured. Let me also retrieve information about Alexander Kerensky to confirm his role and defeat.
steps.observation: Alexander Fyodorovich Kerensky (Russian: Алекса́ндр Фёдорович Ке́ренский , ] ; 4 May 1881 – 11 June 1970) was a Russian lawyer and key political figure in the Russian Revolution of 1917.  After the February Revolution of 1917 he joined the newly formed Russian Provisional Government, first as Minister of Justice, then as Minister of War, and after July 1917 as the government's second Minister-Chairman.  A leader of the moderate-socialist Trudoviks faction of the Socialist Revolutionary Party, he was also vice-chairman of the powerful Petrograd Soviet.  On 7 November, his government was overthrown by the Lenin-led Bolsheviks in the October Revolution.  He spent the remainder of his life in exile, in Paris and New York City, and worked for the Hoover Institution.

steps.thought: Now I have the key information. Alexander Kerensky's government was overthrown by the Bolsheviks in the October Revolution on November 7, 1917. The Russian Civil War that followed lasted from November 1917 to October 1922, with the war effectively ending in 1923 when Red (Bolshevik) control was assured. The document clearly states the war ended in October 1922, with complete control established by 1923.

action_input.answer: The Russian Civil War, in which Alexander Kerensky was defeated by the Bolsheviks, ended in October 1922, with Red control of the newly formed Soviet Union fully assured by 1923.

steps.observation: Task completed. Final answer: The Russian Civil War, in which Alexander Kerensky was defeated by the Bolsheviks, ended in October 1922, with Red control of the newly formed Soviet Union fully assured by 1923.

runs.final_answer: The Russian Civil War, in which Alexander Kerensky was defeated by the Bolsheviks, ended in October 1922, with Red control of the newly formed Soviet Union fully assured by 1923.

steps.observation: The Russian Civil War (Russian: Гражда́нская война́ в Росси́и , "Grazhdanskaya voyna v Rossiyi" ; November 1917 – October 1922) was a multi-party war in the former Russian Empire immediately after the Russian Revolutions of 1917, as many factions vied to determine Russia's political future.  The two largest combatant groups were the Red Army, fighting for the Bolshevik form of socialism led by Vladimir Lenin, and the loosely allied forces known as the White Army, which included diverse interests favoring monarchism, capitalism and alternative forms of socialism, each with democratic and antidemocratic variants.  In addition, rival militant socialists and nonideological Green armies fought against both the Bolsheviks and the Whites.  Eight foreign nations intervened against the Red Army, notably the Allied Forces and the pro-German armies.  The Red Army defeated the White Armed Forces of South Russia in Ukraine and the army led by Admiral Aleksandr Kolchak in Siberia in 1919.  The remains of the White forces commanded by Pyotr Nikolayevich Wrangel were beaten in Crimea and evacuated in late 1920.  Lesser battles of the war continued on the periphery for two more years, and minor skirmishes with the remnants of the White forces in the Far East continued well into 1923.  The war ended in 1923 in the sense that Red control of the newly formed Soviet Union was now assured, although armed national resistance in Central Asia was not completely crushed until 1934.  There were an estimated 7,000,000–12,000,000 casualties during the war, mostly civilians.  The Russian Civil War has been described by some as the greatest national catastrophe that Europe had yet seen.

steps.thought: Perfect! I found the information I need. The document states that the Russian Civil War lasted from November 1917 to October 1922, and it ended in 1923 in the sense that Red (Bolshevik) control was assured. Let me also check the Alexander Kerensky document to confirm his role and defeat.
steps.observation: Alexander Fyodorovich Kerensky (Russian: Алекса́ндр Фёдорович Ке́ренский , ] ; 4 May 1881 – 11 June 1970) was a Russian lawyer and key political figure in the Russian Revolution of 1917.  After the February Revolution of 1917 he joined the newly formed Russian Provisional Government, first as Minister of Justice, then as Minister of War, and after July 1917 as the government's second Minister-Chairman.  A leader of the moderate-socialist Trudoviks faction of the Socialist Revolutionary Party, he was also vice-chairman of the powerful Petrograd Soviet.  On 7 November, his government was overthrown by the Lenin-led Bolsheviks in the October Revolution.  He spent the remainder of his life in exile, in Paris and New York City, and worked for the Hoover Institution.

steps.thought: Now I have all the information I need. Alexander Kerensky's Provisional Government was overthrown by the Bolsheviks in November 1917 (the October Revolution, which occurred in November by the Gregorian calendar). The Russian Civil War that followed, during which Kerensky and other anti-Bolshevik forces were defeated, ended in October 1922, though the war is also said to have ended in 1923 when Bolshevik control was fully assured.

action_input.answer: The Russian Civil War, in which Alexander Kerensky and other anti-Bolshevik forces were defeated by the Bolsheviks, ended in October 1922 (or 1923 when Red control of the Soviet Union was fully assured).

steps.observation: Task completed. Final answer: The Russian Civil War, in which Alexander Kerensky and other anti-Bolshevik forces were defeated by the Bolsheviks, ended in October 1922 (or 1923 when Red control of the Soviet Union was fully assured).

runs.final_answer: The Russian Civil War, in which Alexander Kerensky and other anti-Bolshevik forces were defeated by the Bolsheviks, ended in October 1922 (or 1923 when Red control of the Soviet Union was fully assured).
